comments.html: I hope the new licensing model will take in consideration all the students like me using dynamips to prepare for cisco certifications. It would be great to have a full feature IOS with performance limitations for study purposes. I think dynamips/dynages/GNS3 are some of the most powerful marketing tools for Cisco! If I study Cisco, it's reasonable that I'll buy Cisco. Why they don't support dynamips???  :'(
comments.name: Roland

comments.html: Usually there is a kind of grace period in Cisco's universal images (e.g. in the 3750E series switches). Guess we can use this "feature" for dynamips as well ...
comments.name: Stefan

comments.html:
It is a good news from exploit developer, it'll be easier to get exploitable pointer.
Of course it will take few years to be wide spread.
comments.name: Thomas

comments.html:
To the list of "really new":
- multigigabit fabric (MGF), SM can speak to each other directly
- energy efficiency, you can standby some module, you can use two power adaptor together
comments.name: Andrew

comments.html:
I read performance and I don't understand results (3925 => 100 Mbps ???)
what are they talk about ? interfaces are gigabit on these routers

I have tons of 3825 hsec/k9 with aim-VPN card and in routing/nat they push at 700/800 Mbps
and in VPN Ipsec (esp aes256) => 160 Mbps

so first I don't see any improvements and then I don't understand this "100 Mbps"
comments.name: Nicolas

comments.html:
I'm really hoping Cisco will have the decency to release free or low-cost "educational" licenses for IOS under this new scheme. Ideally these would enable all features yet cripple throughput to perhaps 10 Mbps (or less).

It would also be nice to see them move away from compressed images. Image decompression accounts for a significant portion of boot time, and Flash is so cheap these days there's really no reason for it.
comments.name: stretch

comments.html:
The video was a good laugh!

comments.name: Ronald Bartels

comments.html:
Amazing!
On day Win7 was available worldwide on the market, I almost heard about 30 times the words "Windows 7" in my car on the radio in the morning.

Why didn't I heared about worldwide availbility of the new cisco ISRs also in the radio? Shame on Cisco marketing team : they were not able to force my collegues at work to talk about the new ISRs all day long! :-P
comments.name: C23
